segments.text: I notice the boy is stretching so far to grab those cookies, and the stool looks like it’s about to tip.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her turn, like this is completely normal.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is pouring over the sink, and the woman doesn’t even seem to care.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her apron is getting wet, but she’s still polishing that plate like it’s the most important thing in the world.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t help but laugh at how oblivious she is to everything around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so peaceful, but inside, it’s pure chaos.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if the kids are going to get caught before the stool falls.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is like a silent movie where everyone is about to slip on a banana peel.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel like I should yell at them to be careful, but no one would hear me.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The light from the window makes everything look so calm, but it’s all an illusion.
segments.speaker: PAR
